Message.Title: fish2kill, you disappoint me. I found your long "challenge." It's dribble. I copied and posted it within. Are you joking?? Citing Los Vegas odds makers to support your position??? Are you NUTS? And about my "interpretation", I just posted the article, didn't "interpret" a thing. I gave you the benefit of the doubt that you had an ounce of logic and could put emotion aside for a moment, but all you got is more emotional rants. You are NUTS!!!
Message.Msg: You're just using old and irrelevant data, and then cherry-picking it for evidence that supports your position. In case you hadn't noticed, there have been some significant developments on the political scene since that poll was taken. The article you cite mentions that the poll was taken 'in the days leading up to the Ryan announcement.' On the last of those days, Friday August 10th, the Las Vegas odds (money line) were Obama -170, Romney +140. (meaning that to win $100 on an Obama victory, one needed to wager $170; whereas a $100 bet on a Romney victory would result in winnings of $140. In both cases, those numbers are the profit above and beyond the original amount wagered, which is returned to the bettor only if he wins the bet.) Today, those odds have widened in Obama's favor to -200 vs. Romney's +160. Furthermore, a simplistic poll of all voters is all but irrelevant in an election determined not by the popular vote, but by the Electoral College vote. The Romney-Ryan ticket certainly threw red meat to the GOP hard right, but that group was in no danger of voting for Obama anyway. Instead, the outcome of this election will be determined in swing states by swing voters, and it is there that Romney will go down in flames. I can't tell whether you're trying to fool others, or yourself, but no fooling, Romney just committed political suicide, and if you're applauding his choice, I'm delighting to join in with you. ROTFLMAO at data interpretation errors everywhere.

Message.Title: Hypocrite Mitt
Message.Msg: Though an early supporter of the Vietnam War, and according to Selective Service records, Romney avoided military service at the height of the fighting after high school by seeking and receiving four draft deferments. They included a 31-month stretch as a "minister of religion" in Paris, France, a classification for Mormon missionaries that the Mormon church at the time feared was being overused. When troop levels were cut, and, also, when he was assigned a high Selective Service draft lottery number, his "mission to France" came to and end.

Message.Title: Gay Activist Opens Fire at family reserach council injuring one
Message.Msg: A security guard at the Family Research Council's headquarters in Washington, D.C. is being hailed as a hero after he stopped a gunman posing as an intern, taking a bullet in the arm before wrestling the suspect to the ground. The gunman entered the lobby of the organization's Chinatown headquarters around 10:45 and expressed disagreement with the conservative group's policy positions, Fox News has learned. When the guard, who was not identified, asked him where he was going, he opened fire, according to police. “The security guard here is a hero, as far as I’m concerned,” D.C. Police Chief Cathy Lanier said. ”He did his job. The person never made it past the front.” The guard, who was not identified, was shot in the arm and was conscious after the shooting and was in stable condition. The gunman, who also was not identified, was being questioned by the FBI, sources said. Sources said he is in his twenties. The suspect "made statements regarding their policies, and then opened fire with a gun striking a security guard," a source told Fox News. WJLA-TV7 reported the suspect was also shot. Sources also said the gunman may have been carrying a bag from Chick-fil-A, the embattled fast-food restaurant whose president came under fire from gay activists after he said he did not agree with same-sex marriage. Sources told Fox New that after guard took away his gun, the suspect said, "Don't shoot me, it was not about you, it was what this place stands for." Authorities were treating the attack as a case of domestic terrorism, although James McJunkin, the head of the FBI’s Washington Field Office, said authorities do not yet know the gunman's motive.

Message.Title: Biden puts foot in mouth yet again...Thinks we are still in the 20th century!!
Message.Msg: Biden is the gift that keeps on giving SPORTSMariners' Hernandez tosses perfect game1 of 9SCITECHNew galaxy cluster may be most massive ever2 of 9VIDEOMotorbike in China loaded with 8 passengers3 of 9POLITICAL HOTSHEETGallup: No early bounce for Romney after VP pick4 of 9U.S.Rower finishes 1,500-mile trip after sex attack5 of 9CRIMESIDERCops: Priest chased boy in street after abuse6 of 9GALLERYTexas family welcomes quintuplets7 of 9MARKETS & INVESTINGHow to figure out if you're financially secure8 of 9VIDEORare sand kittens born at Israel zoo9 of 9 August 15, 2012 2:22 PM PRINT TEXT Biden revives 'Etch-A-Sketch' remark in blasting Romney comments30 inShare More By Rodney Hawkins Topics Campaign 2012 Vice President Joe Biden speaks during a campaign stop at the Spiller Elementary School in Wytheville, Va., Tuesday, August 14, 2012. (Credit: AP Photo /Don Petersen) (CBS News) BLACKSBURG, Va. --Despite being subjected to withering Republican rebukes about his attacks on Mitt Romney, Vice President Joe Biden on Wednesday kept up his criticism of the presumed GOP nominee -- though in subtler fashion. Campaigning in Blacksburg, an emotional Biden invoked Romney aide Eric Fehrnstrom's now-infamous "Etch-A-Sketch" remark referring to being able to restart what is said in the general-election campaign after the primaries. Democrats and even Republicans who ran against Romney called the comment an example of their rival's political malleability. "This is not a mystery anymore," Biden said of the choice voters face in the fall. "This is not a mystery, and the ability to take out that Etch-A-Sketch pad that Governor Romney's advisers said -- the Etch-a-sketch is gone. This is sort of written pretty clearly; it is almost-- not in stone -- it is clearly defined and it gives us an ability of the American people to have an absolute unfettered clear view." Biden's remark came a day after he told a diverse crowd that included many African-Americans that Romney would "put you all back in chains" by unshackling Wall Street. Republicans reacted with outrage, calling it needlessly divisive, but Biden stood by his statement. After Wednesday's speech, Republicans opted to pounce on a different Biden statement. "Folks, where's it written we cannot lead the world in the 20th century in making automobiles?" the vice president said. That prompted Romney spokesman Ryan Williams to say in a statement: "Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan will ensure America leads the world in the 21st century by strengthening middle-class families and creating jobs."

Message.Title: Are you ready for bac $8+ closing tomorrow?
Message.Msg: Cover your shorts before the market opens. The internals of the larger market are in better shape... than what appears. The volume is shrinking... and could be also a good sign for the market as most most folks follow the noise (news spreading fear) and not the market internals. If the bac pps jumps more than 5%, I would be a seller as I have been profitablly trading it... since the market bottom in March 2009! I already show profits on my recent purchase (in low $7's) now. GLTA!

Topic.Title: Good for Romney he came out fighting back today "Mr. President, take your campaign of division and anger and hate back to Chicago and let us get about rebuilding and reuniting America,"

Message.Msg: i really think the silent majority which is the middle class have factored in all the data of the 2012 pres. election and have come to the conclusion like they did in 2008. TIME TO MAKE A CHANGE!!! IN 2008 they wanted change but now they have decided although they wanted change they did not want what this pres. has done. just look at the stance the liberals took on obamacare. majority of America does not want it but they did it anyhow. plus congress made themselves exempt from abomacare. Americans see Europe and the mess they are in and realize this pres. is pushing the US in the same direction. 2012 election is going to be a crucial time in American history.-jmho-bucko ps-i am in favor of all congressmen and the presidency to be limited to one 6 yr. term. no relections, no need for a elected offical to campaign after their inital election. term limit-1 term. that's it.

Topic.Title: Good for Romney he came out fighting back today "Mr. President, take your campaign of division and anger and hate back to Chicago and let us get about rebuilding and reuniting America,"

Message.Msg: Hey, keno_runner24. What is that nonsense from Mitt... Was the GOP the picture of cooperation with Obama when they declared as the enemy no. 1 immediately after his election? You think the people are sheep to forget the deliberate rejection and sabotage GOP practiced in the last 4 years to talk of now "rebuilding and REUNITING America"? You must be a blinded follower of your affiliation to GOP. I'm independent and I know many like me that will not vote not only for the damage the GOP lack of cooperation caused to our nation... but Romney's pick of Paul Ryan- the zealot ideologue! Times are achanging and the tide is rising against the GOP.

Topic.Title: IF ELECTIONS ARE WON ON IDEAS, WHY IS THE REPUCANS TRYING TO SUPPRESS VOTING

Message.Msg: You are mistaken my friend, the Democrats let dead people and illegal aliens vote and without ID the Democrats like to cheat into this election as they did in all of the previous elections. If you are legit voter, there is nothing to fear about, show your ID and get the ballot.
